00028 /*!
00029 
00030  Create an instance of the Crypto Processor Interface.
00031 
00032   @param p_cpi_info (INP) - CPI Info used to initialize CPI instance
00033   @param pp_cpi (OUT) - Pointer to CPI instance
00034   @return CPI_OK for success, otherwise CPI_ error code
00035 
00036 */
00037 
00038 int cpi_create(struct _cpi_info_t *p_cpi_info, struct _cpi_t **pp_cpi);
00039 
00040 /*!
00041 
00042  Closes an instance of the Crypto Processor Interface.
00043 
00044   @param p_cpi (INP) - CPI instance
00045   @return CPI_OK for success, otherwise CPI_ error code
00046 
00047  */
00048 
00049 int cpi_close(struct _cpi_t *p_cpi);
00050 
00051 /*!
00052 
00053  Initialize an instance of the Crypto Processor Interface. Must be called before
00054  any other API calls, aside from cpi_create and cpi_close.
00055 
00056   @param p_cpi (INP) - CPI instance
00057   @param serial_device_path (INP) - Path to proper serial device (e.g. "/dev/ttyS2")
00058   @return CPI_OK for success, otherwise CPI_ error code
00059 
00060  */
00061 
00062 int cpi_init(struct _cpi_t *p_cpi, char *serial_device_path);
00063 
00064 /*!
00065 
00066  Process the specified XML command, and return the result in XML.
00067 
00068   @param p_cpi (INP) - CPI instance
00069   @param inp_xml_str (INP) - XML input string (<= CPI_MAX_RESULT_SIZE bytes, including null terminator)
00070   @param out_xml_str (OUT) - XML output string (>= CPI_MAX_RESULT_SIZE bytes, including null terminator)
00071   @return CPI_OK for success, otherwise CPI_ error code
00072 
00073  */
00074 
00075 int cpi_process_xml(struct _cpi_t *p_cpi, char *inp_xml_str, char *out_xml_str);
00076 
00077 /*!
00078 
00079  Get the putative ID of the specified key.
00080 
00081   @param p_cpi (INP) - CPI instance
00082   @param cpi_key_id (INP) - CPI Key ID
00083   @param str (OUT) - ASCII buffer at least CPI_PUTATIVE_ID_SIZE bytes in size. Format
00084                      is ASCII GUID format (e.g. "01234567-89AB-CDEF-0123-456789ABCDEF")
00085   @return CPI_OK for success, otherwise CPI_ error code
00086 
00087  */
00088 
00089 int cpi_get_putative_id(struct _cpi_t *p_cpi, uint16_t cpi_key_id, char *str);
00090 
00091 /*!
00092 
00093  Get the public key.
00094 
00095   @param p_cpi (INP) - CPI instance
00096   @param cpi_key_id (INP) - CPI Key ID
00097   @param str (OUT) - ASCII buffer at least CPI_MAX_RESULT_SIZE bytes in size. Format
00098                      is RFC2440 section 5.5.2-compliant version 3 public key subkey packet
00099   @return CPI_OK for success, otherwise CPI_ error code
00100 
00101  */
00102 
00103 int cpi_get_public_key(struct _cpi_t *p_cpi, uint16_t cpi_key_id, char *str);
00104

00213 /*!
00214 
00215  Issue a challenge to the CP.
00216 
00217   @param p_cpi (INP) - CPI instance
00218   @param cpi_key_id (INP) - CPI Key ID
00219   @param rand_data (INP) - Raw random binary data CPI_RNDX_SIZE bytes in size.
00220   @param result1 (OUT) - Buffer at least CPI_RESULT1_SIZE bytes in size, which holds result 1.
00221   @param result2 (OUT) - Buffer at least CPI_RESULT2_SIZE bytes in size, which holds result 2.
00222   @return CPI_OK for success, otherwise CPI_ error code
00223 
00224  */
00225 
00226   int cpi_issue_challenge(struct _cpi_t *p_cpi, uint16_t cpi_key_id, uint8_t *rand_data, uint8_t *result1, uint8_t *result2, uint8_t *result3);

00236 typedef struct _cpi_t
00237 {
00238     /*! serial device file handle */
00239     int serial_file;
00240     /*! initialization flag */
00241     int is_initialized;
00242     /*! temporary buffer */
00243     char *tmp_buff; 
00244     /*! temporary buffer, for XML parsing */
00245     char *tmp_buff_xml;
00246 }
00247 cpi_t;

00264 /*! \name CPI sizes, in bytes */
00265 /*! \{ */
00266 #define CPI_MAX_RESULT_SIZE         0x1000  /*!< 4096 bytes, @todo finalize this max */
00267 #define CPI_PUTATIVE_ID_SIZE        0x0025  /*!< 37 bytes, includes null terminator */
00268 #define CPI_VERSION_SIZE            0x0006  /*!< 6 bytes, raw binary data */
00269 #define CPI_SERIAL_NUMBER_SIZE      0x0010  /*!< 16 bytes, raw binary data */
00270 #define CPI_HARDWARE_VERSION_SIZE   0x0010  /*!< 16 bytes, raw binary data */
00271 #define CPI_HPIDX_SIZE              0x0014  /*!< 20 bytes, raw binary data */
00272 #define CPI_RNDX_SIZE               0x0010  /*!< 16 bytes, raw binary data */
00273 #define CPI_RESULT1_SIZE            0x0114  /*!< 276 bytes, raw binary data, holds encrypted owner key, "Rm", and 4 byte version data */
00274 #define CPI_RESULT1_ENC_OK_SIZE     0x0100  /*!< 256 bytes, raw binary data, holds encrypted owner key result */
00275 #define CPI_RESULT1_RAND_SIZE       0x0010  /*!< 16 bytes, raw binary data, holds "Rm" random data */
00276 #define CPI_RESULT1_VERS_SIZE       0x0004  /*!< 4 bytes, raw binary data, holds 4 byte version data */
00277 #define CPI_RESULT2_SIZE            0x0080  /*!< 128 bytes, raw binary data, holds signature result */
00278 #define CPI_RESULT3_SIZE            (416)   /*!< 416 bytes, raw binary data, holds hash result, rounded to nearest block length */
00279 /*! \} */
00280 
00281 /*! \name CPI return codes */
00282 /*! \{ */
00283 #define CPI_OK                  0x0000  /*!< Success! */
00284 #define CPI_FAIL                0x0001  /*!< Generic failure */
00285 #define CPI_NOTIMPL             0x0002  /*!< Functionality not implemented */
00286 #define CPI_INVALID_PARAM       0x0003  /*!< Invalid parameter */
00287 #define CPI_OUT_OF_MEMORY       0x0004  /*!< Out of memory */
00288 #define CPI_ACCESS_DENIED       0x0005  /*!< Access denied */
00289 #define CPI_INVALID_CALL        0x0006  /*!< Invalid call */
00290 /*! \} */
00291 
00292 /*! \name CPI return code lookup table, for convienence */
00293 /*! \{ */
00294 char *CPI_RETURN_CODE_LOOKUP[0x07];
00295 /*! \} */
00296 
00297 /*! \name CPI return code helper functions */
00298 /*! \{ */
00299 /*! Detect success error code */
00300 #define CPI_SUCCESS(x) (x == CPI_OK)
00301 /*! Detect failure error code */
00302 #define CPI_FAILED(x) (x != CPI_OK)
00303 /*! \} */
00304 
00305 #ifdef __cplusplus
00306 }
00307 #endif
00308 
00309 #endif
